ci_support_linux_64_.yaml:
cdt_name:
- conda
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
python_min:
- '3.9'

about.description:
Use nbgitpuller-link to create an URL used by nbgitpuller
<https://jupyterhub.github.io/nbgitpuller> to provision files from a git
repository on a JupyterHub. nbgitpuller-link has a handy, scriptable CLI
and a Python API.
about.summary: Generate an nbgitpuller link through a command-line interface or Python code

about.description:
Use nbgitpuller-link to create an URL used by nbgitpuller
<https://jupyterhub.github.io/nbgitpuller> to provision files from a git
repository on a JupyterHub. nbgitpuller-link has a handy, scriptable CLI
and a Python API.
about.summary: Generate an nbgitpuller link through a command-line interface or Python code

name: nbgitpuller-link
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set name = "nbgitpuller-link" %}
{% set version = "0.2.5" %}
# {% set python_min = python_min|default("3.10") %}
{% set python_min = "3.10" %}

package:
  name: {{ name|lower }}
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  url: https://pypi.org/packages/source/{{ name[0] }}/{{ name }}/{{ name }}-{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 3cdb47ab8a0bb6ed90c93b6d26056a55035e6a20fb3e97ee1f2083836da1a390

build:
  noarch: python
  number: 1
  script: {{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . -vv
  entry_points:
    - nbgitpuller-link=nbgitpuller_link.cli:main

requirements:
  host:
    - python {{ python_min }}
    - pip
    - setuptools
  run:
    - python >={{ python_min }}
    - click
    - validators

test:
  imports:
    - nbgitpuller_link
  requires:
    - pip
    - python {{ python_min }}
  commands:
    - pip check
    - nbgitpuller-link --version
    - nbgitpuller-link --help

about:
  home: https://github.com/mdpiper/nbgitpuller-link
  license: MIT
  license_family: MIT
  license_file: LICENSE.md
  summary: |
    Generate an nbgitpuller link through a command-line interface or Python code
  description: |
    Use nbgitpuller-link to create an URL used by nbgitpuller
    <https://jupyterhub.github.io/nbgitpuller> to provision files from a git
    repository on a JupyterHub. nbgitpuller-link has a handy, scriptable CLI
    and a Python API.

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - mdpiper
